docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30, (Reuters) -- The ruling Colorado party still held a narrow but apparently winning lead over the National party today as the counting of votes in the Uruguayan presidential election continued slowly and amid charges of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30, (Reuters) -- The ruling Colorado party still held a narrow but apparently winning lead over the National party today as the counting of votes in the Uruguayan presidential election continued slowly and amid charges of irregularities.
docs.abstract: Colorado party holds lead over Natl party as vote counting, Uruguay, continues slowly and amid charges of irregularities; tally

headline.main: RULING PARTY'S LEAD HOLDING IN URUGUAY

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30 (UPI) -- Michele Ray, a French reporter, was kidnapped at gunpoint from her residence yesterday and she was still being sought today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 30 (UPI) -- Michele Ray, a French reporter, was kidnapped at gunpoint from her residence yesterday and she was still being sought today.
docs.abstract: French reporter M Ray kidnapped, Montevideo, reptdly by terrorist group known as OPR-33; she came to Uruguay Nov 18 to cover Pres election for French TV and radio

headline.main: Michele Ray Kidnapped From Uruguay Home

docs.snippet: In a record turnout, Uruguay's voters demonstrated emphatically that they have not given up on the country's democratic system and greatly prefer the two traditional parties to a leftist coalition similar to the one now governing Chile. The Frente...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a record turnout, Uruguay's voters demonstrated emphatically that they have not given up on the country's democratic system and greatly prefer the two traditional parties to a leftist coalition similar to the one now governing Chile. The Frente Amplio (Broad Front), embracing Communists, Socialists, radical Catholics and others, made a respectable showing; but even in Montevideo, where it had hoped to elect a mayor, the Front trailed the governing Colorado party by 50,000 votes.
docs.abstract: ed on results of Uruguayan Pres election sees voters giving traditional parties new chance to transform Uruguayan soc and pol while maintaining dem system

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 3 -- Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba said today that his Government was prepared to establish diplomatic relations with any Latin American country that "is willing to defy the United States."
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 3 -- Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba said today that his Government was prepared to establish diplomatic relations with any Latin American country that "is willing to defy the United States."
docs.abstract: Cuban Premier Castro refuses to comment on results of Uruguayan election but confirms that he has told group of leftist RC priests that election results have shown that 'armed revolution is only revolutionary road for Uruguay,' s, Chile

headline.main: Castro, in Chilean Talk, Offers Links to Nations Defying U.S.

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The election in Uruguay last week was billed as "perhaps another Chile," a contest between capitalism and some form of socialism, with the left given a good chance of winning as it did in Chile a year ago. But as the returns mounted slowly, it was...
docs.lead_paragraph: The election in Uruguay last week was billed as "perhaps another Chile," a contest between capitalism and some form of socialism, with the left given a good chance of winning as it did in Chile a year ago. But as the returns mounted slowly, it was clear by the weekend that the left and socialism were the losers.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 7 (AP) -- Two retired generals who were losers in the presidential election nine days ago fought a pistol duel today. Each man fired two shots but missed.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 7 (AP) -- Two retired generals who were losers in the presidential election nine days ago fought a pistol duel today. Each man fired two shots but missed.
docs.abstract: 2 ret gens who lost in Uruguayan Pres election fight pistol duel, Montevideo, but both miss

headline.main: 2 Uruguayans Who Lost In Vote Also Miss in Duel

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 -- The White House expressed confidence today that the United States would reach an "interim arrangement of some sort" with Brazil to permit American fishing fleets to operate off the Brazilian coast.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 -- The White House expressed confidence today that the United States would reach an "interim arrangement of some sort" with Brazil to permit American fishing fleets to operate off the Brazilian coast.
docs.abstract: White House press sec Ziegler, following 3-day state visit by Brazil's Pres Medici, repts US is hopeful of reaching 'interim arrangement of some sort' with Brazil to permit Amer fishing fleets to operate off Brazilian coast; Ziegler's remark is 1st indication that US is seeking fishing agreement with Latin-Amer nations that claim sovereignty 200 miles off their coasts; State Dept official surprised that US is attempting to solve dispute with Latin-Amer nations before an internatl conf on maritime law meets in Stockholm in '73

headline.main: U.S. Hopeful on Fishing Pact With Brazil

byline.original: By JAMES M. NAUGHTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 10 -- Twelve days after the Uruguayan general election, an official recount required by law took up its slow pace again today. No one was certain who would be the next President and no one was likely to be certain until...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 10 -- Twelve days after the Uruguayan general election, an official recount required by law took up its slow pace again today. No one was certain who would be the next President and no one was likely to be certain until mid-January.
docs.abstract: slow vote recount narrows Pres race from 11 candidates to 2, Min Bordaberry and Sen Ferreira Aldunate, but most Uruguayans are indifferent to results following defeat of leftist coalition; latter quietly begins to prepare for cong of supporters; calls pro-coalition vote significant because it is 9% more than aggregate vote of all member parties in previous elections

headline.main: Uruguay Vote Still Undecided, but Suspense Is Gone

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Barbados and Costa Rica and Uruguay submit 2 compromise resolutions to UN Gen Assembly calling for resumption of indirect talks between Egypt and Israel clearing way for final vote in Mideast debate; neither resolution refers to Jarring's Feb 8 memo...
docs.abstract: Barbados and Costa Rica and Uruguay submit 2 compromise resolutions to UN Gen Assembly calling for resumption of indirect talks between Egypt and Israel clearing way for final vote in Mideast debate; neither resolution refers to Jarring's Feb 8 memo in which Israel was asked for commitment to withdraw from occupied territories as move to break deadlocked peace talks; Israel reptdly can accept either resolution if adopted by Assembly

headline.main: Israel Behind 2 New Proposals At U.N. Urging Peace Talks

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 13 -- The General Assembly tonight overwhelmingly adopted an Egyptian-supported resolution calling on Israel to withdraw from the Egyptian territory she has occupied since the June, 1967, war.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 13 -- The General Assembly tonight overwhelmingly adopted an Egyptian-supported resolution calling on Israel to withdraw from the Egyptian territory she has occupied since the June, 1967, war.

headline.main: ASSEMBLY BACKS DEMAND OF EGYPT FOR FULL PULLOUT; U.N., 79-7, Asks Israel to Withdraw to 1967 Lines -- the U.S. Abstains U.N. Backs Egypt on Israeli Withdrawal

byline.original: By TERENCE SMITHSpecial to The New York Times
